page.title: 01THE AREA WEST OF STROUD
page.content: The River Frome runs through a valley in the south of the area.To the north the land rises gradually towards Randwick and to the south it rises steeply towards Selsley Hill and Common. These beautiful hills mark the edge of the Cotswolds and overlook the wide Severn Vale. There are a large number of houses especially at Ebley and Stonehouse in the valley; Randwick is a small hill village of Cotswold stone houses, while Stonehouse is a growing town. In the Frome Valley the A419 runs parallel to the main-line railway passing through Stroud and Stonehouse.There is also the derelict Stroudwater Canal. A cycle track has recently been made on the old railway line which was used by the Dudbridge Donkey. At some places along the river there are mills which once produced cloth.
